properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 15 cm is expected. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2020-02-24T02:38:52-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-02-23T10:38:52-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2924359747.2020
Area: R.M. of Deer Forks including Burstall and Estuary, R.M. of Happyland including Leader Prelate and Mendham, R.M. of Enterprise including Richmound, R.M. of Fox Valley including Fox Valley, R.M. of Big Stick including Golden Prairie, R.M. of Clinworth including Sceptre Lemsford and Portreeve, R.M. of Miry Creek including Abbey Lancer and Shackleton, R.M. of Pittville including Hazlet, R.M. of Piapot including Piapot, R.M. of Gull Lake including Gull Lake and Tompkins, R.M. of Carmichael including Carmichael, R.M. of Maple Creek including Maple Creek, R.M. of Maple Creek including Cypress Hills Prov. Park, R.M. of Reno including Consul Robsart and Willow Creek, R.M. of Arlington including Dollard, R.M. of White Valley including Eastend and Ravenscrag, R.M. of Frontier including Frontier and Claydon, R.M. of Bone Creek including Simmie and Scotsguard, R.M. of Grassy Creek including Shaunavon, R.M. of Wise Creek including Cadillac and Admiral, R.M. of Lone Tree including Climax and Bracken, R.M. of Val Marie including Val Marie Orkney and Monchy, R.M. of Auvergne including Ponteix and Aneroid, R.M. of Pinto Creek including Kincaid and Hazenmore, R.M. of Glen McPherson west of Mankota, R.M. of Mankota including Mankota and Ferland

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. A Pacific storm is forecast to move across northern Vancouver Island Sunday morning. In the wake of the system, strong northwest winds 80 gusting to 100 km/h will develop over West Vancouver Island Sunday afternoon. Winds will ease Sunday night as the storm tracks farther inland. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-02-23T20:40:44-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-02-23T04:41:44-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1920479877.2020
Area: West Vancouver Island
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Alert Is Being Issued For The Town Of Eatonia.
properties.Summary:
Description: A Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued for the Town of Eatonia. This advisory is for the entire community and for any individuals who may access water from the Town of Eatonia's water system. This advisory is in effect until further notice.
Expires: 2020-02-28T17:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Eatonia and RM of Chesterfield, 2020-02-22T14:55:11-06:00, 8EE333F7-A775-7F38-0FBD-C3C475BFB564
Area: Town of Eatonia
properties.Author: SK Eatonia and RM of Chesterfield

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. A Pacific storm is forecast to move across northern Vancouver Island Sunday morning. As this system approaches, strong southeasterly winds 60 to 80 km/h will develop over the Gulf Islands, Sunshine Coast and parts of East Vancouver Island overnight. Winds will quickly veer to the west and weaken by Sunday morning. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-02-23T20:42:43-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-02-23T04:43:43-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0419080671.2020
Area: East Vancouver Island - Nanoose Bay to Fanny Bay, East Vancouver Island - Courtenay to Campbell River, Sunshine Coast - Gibsons to Earls Cove, Sunshine Coast - Saltery Bay to Powell River, Southern Gulf Islands
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of very cold wind chills is expected. Extreme wind chill values of -50 or colder redeveloped last night as northwesterly winds of 20 to 30 km/h combines with temperatures in the mid minus thirties. The extreme cold will moderate late this morning or early this afternoon as temperatures begin to rise. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-02-23T21:59:04-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-02-23T09:16:04-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2980201014.2020
Area: Iqaluit
properties.Author: Environment Canada
